page.title: 10Attitudes to the Government
page.content: Sale is a traditionally safe Tory seat. A survey of 188 people showed 52 approving of and 121 against Government policies. Points made by those in support: reducing inflation, not giving in to strikes or EEC, increasing home ownership, reducing union power, encouraging increased competitiveness. Against: causing mass unemployment(particularly amonst the young), cuts in money for education and the NHS, high interest rates, no compassion or understanding,increasing the impoverished N/prosperous S division, 'poor deal' for retirement pensioners, abolishing local democracy (Metropolitan Councils), lack of overseas aid. The respondents were strongly divided over the retention of nuclear weapons and the Falklands War.
